subject: [Ip-health] When customs authorities may infringing goods to be imported into the United States
body:
http://www.keionline.org/index.php?option=com_jd-wp&Itemid=39&p=32

When customs authorities may infringing goods to be imported into the
United States
June 9th, 2007 by James Love

The TRIPS, in Part III, Section 4, has a number of obligations on
countries for border measures. These measures require some mechanism
to prevent imports of infringing products, but they also give member
states considerable flexibility.

    [snip]

------------------------------------
James Packard Love
